properties.name: Pueblo Grande Musuem
properties.description: 4619 E Washington Street Phoenix, AZ 85034 (602) 495-0900 http://www.pueblogrande.org Monday - Saturday 9AM-4:45PM Sunday 1PM-4:45PM Museum Admission rates: $6 Adults $5 Seniors (55+) $3 Children ages 6-17 Free Children 5 and under Pueblo Grande Museum and Archaeological Park is the site of a 1,500 year-old Hohokam village ruin located just minutes away from Sky Harbor International Airport in metropolitan Phoenix. A National Historic Landmark and an Arizona Point of Pride, there's something for everyone to explore: an 800 year-old, Classic period, Hohokam Platform Mound ruin excavated prehistoric ballcourt two full-scale reproductions of prehistoric Hohokam dwellings outdoor walking trail featuring native plants indoor exhibits geared towards all ages picnic area special programming, events, and lectures

properties.name: Hall of Flame Fire Musuem
properties.description: 6101 E Van Buren Street Phoenix, AZ Monday - Saturday 9AM-5PM Sunday 12PM-4PM (602) 275-3473 http://www.hallofflame.org The Hall of Flame Fire Museum and the National Firefighting Hall of Heroes, located in Phoenix, Arizona, has almost an acre of fire history exhibits, with over 90 fully restored pieces of fire apparatus on display, dating from 1725 to 1969. Most of the exhibits are American, but we also have pieces from England, France, Austria, Germany, and Japan. The Hall of Flame sponsors the National Firefighting Hall of Heroes.

properties.name: Hackett House
properties.description: 95 W 4th Street Tempe, AZ 85281-2825 (480) 350-8181 http://www.hacketthouse.org Welcome to Hackett House, a charming historical building located in the heart of downtown Tempe. Within the Hackett House you will find a wonderful gift shop filled with unique and whimsical items. The Hackett House also offers an amazing array of programs and events throughout the year and is available for private parties, weddings and corporate events. All funds raised through the Hackett House support City of Tempe programs, as well as the award-winning Tempe Sister City Organization, which sponsors student, teacher, practical and professional exchange programs with Tempe's eight international sister cities. Hackett House will be closing its doors for the summer on May 29, 2010 and will re-open on September 13, 2010. Check back in September for our 25th Season Schedule of Events, including our Volunteer Round-up scheduled for September 11, 2010.

properties.name: Arizona Historical Society Museum
properties.description: 1300 North College Avenue Tempe, AZ 85281-1211 (480) 929-0292 http://www.arizonahistoricalsociety.org Tuesday - Saturday 10AM-4PM Sunday 12PM-4PM General Admission Adults $5 Ages 60+ $4 Ages 12-18 $4 Ages 11 and younger free AHS Members free Free admission the first Saturday of the month The Museum at Papago Park is the principal museum in the Phoenix metropolitan area covering the changes that have made Arizona what it is today. Concentrating on Arizona in the 20th and 21st centuries, the museum is filled with stories—stories about World War II and its effects in Arizona, stories about the rise of desert cities, and stories about Arizona popular culture. The museum brings stories to life through engaging exhibits, hands-on and multimedia displays, children’s activities, and a variety of educational programs.

properties.name: Alwun House
properties.description: 1204 E Roosevelt Street Phoenix, AZ 85006-3454 (602) 253-7887 http://www.alwunhouse.org Tuesday - Friday 12PM - 6PM Showcasing arts in the valley for over 30 years, the Alwun House is notorious for throwing some of the most outrageous parties downtown — and it all goes down in an art gallery. The house, set in the historic Garfield District, has cultivated fans for nearly 40 years with groundbreaking art (exotic and horror themes are especially popular), theater productions and poetry readings. Leave your worries (and inhibitions) at the door; when you go to Alwun House, you become part of the very unique, and sometimes dysfunctional, community of art fans.

properties.name: Arizona Doll & Toy Museum
properties.description: 602 E Adams Street Phoenix, AZ 85004 (602) 253-9337 Tue - Sat 10AM-4PM Sun 12PM-4PM Dolls and toys of today and yesteryears. Nonprofit, charitable and educational.

properties.name: African American Multicultural Museum
properties.description:
617 N Scottsdale Road
Scottsdale, AZ 85257 
(480) 314-4400 
museum@prodigy.net
http://aammuseum.org

Entrance Fee 
Free

Hours of Operation
Thursday - Saturday: 1PM - 5PM 
Group or special functions may be scheduled any day of the week. 

Museum Description
The African American Multicultural Museum is a local Museum with a global perspective.  An extensive variety of exhibits and programs featuring art, historical items, speakers, and artist will be highlighted throughout the year.  The Museum will keynote multiculturalism by emphasizing the positive contributions of many races and cultures while incorporating the African American segment.  Our mission is “Fellowship through Education”.  When people learn about the positive contributions of others regardless of race or gender, it affords us the opportunity to appreciate our differences and celebrate our similarities.  The Museum will be one of the vehicles that teach the earth’s human inhabitants that they are brothers and sisters under one big blue sky.  Come view and join the journey!

properties.name: Children's Museum of Phoenix
properties.description: 215 N 7th Street Phoenix, AZ 85034 (602) 253-0501 Tuesday - Sunday 9AM-4PM http://www.childrensmuseumofphoenix.org Hands-on, interactive exhibits designed for children ages birth to 10, the Museum focuses on learning through play, with emphasis on early childhood education and school-readiness.

properties.name: ASU Art Museum
properties.description: SE Corner of Mill Avenue and 10th Street Tuesday: 11AM-8PM Wednesday - Saturday: 11AM-5PM Additional educator hours by appointment: Mondays and before 11AM Tuesday–Thursday Closed: Sunday, Monday and Holidays The ASU Art Museum serves as a laboratory for thinking about and enjoying art in innovative ways. Through four new program initiatives including Global Arizona, which focuses on addressing important societal issues, whether local or global; Social Studies, which invites a visiting artist to turn a gallery into a working studio; InterLab, which invites interdisciplinary work of faculty, students and others; and Moving Targets, which builds on the museum's long history of exploring the role of new media in the arts, we are both presenting and exploring the highest quality of art as well as defining the museum of the future.

properties.name: Arizona Military Museum
properties.description: 5636 East McDowell Road Entrance: 52nd St & McDowell Rd Phoenix, Arizona 85008-3495 (602) 267-2676 or (602) 253-2378 http://www.azdema.gov/museum/index.html http://azmemory.lib.az.us/cdm4/ Entrance Fee Free Hours of Operation Saturday & Sunday, 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM Group tours by appointment only Closed during summer months Museum Description Sponsored by the Arizona National Guard Historical Society, this remodeled arsenal features memorabilia relating to the military history of Arizona and its residents, including uniforms, weapons, photographs, and archival material.

properties.name: Arizona Science Center
properties.description: Heritage & Science Park 600 E Washington Street Phoenix, Arizona 85004 (602) 716-2000 htp://www.azscience.org 10AM to 5PM Monday - Sunday General Admission Pricing Adult $12 Senior (62+) $10 Child (3-17) $10 Planetarium, hands-on learning exhibits and IMAX theatre

properties.name: Phoenix Police Musuem
properties.description: 101 S Central Avenue Phoenix, AZ 85004-2410 (602) 534-7278 http://www.phoenixpolicemuseum.com The history of the department through collections and exhibits, features police artifacts dating from the late 1800s, commemorates more than 125 years of service.

properties.name: Arizona State Capitol Museum
properties.description: 1700 W Washington Street Phoenix, AZ 85007 Info (602) 926-3620 Tours (602) 926-3628 http://www.lib.az.us/museum/ Entrance Fee Free Hours of Operation Monday - Friday, 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM Saturday/Sunday - Closed This National Register site served as both the Capitol of the Arizona Territory and the State Capitol and has been restored to its historic appearance. Exhibits: House and Senate Chambers, offices of Governor and Secretary of State, hands-on exhibit for sight impaired, and more. Gift shop.

properties.name: Museo Chicano
properties.description: 147 E Adams Street Phoenix, AZ 85004 (602) 257-5536 http://www.museochicano.com Entrance Fee Admission Charge Hours of Operation Tuesday - Saturday, 10:00AM - 4:00PM Museum Description Chicano Museum and Latino Center for the arts, presenting changing exhibits on the culture of Latinos. Related workshops, classes, and seminars are conducted. Guided tours available on request. Gift shop and Bookstore.

properties.name: Phoenix Museum of History
properties.description: Heritage & Science Park 105 North 5th Street Phoenix, Arizona 85004-4404 (602) 253-2734 info@pmoh.org http://www.pmoh.org/ Entrance Fee Admission charge Hours of Operation Tuesday - Saturday, 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM Museum Description Dynamic interactive exhibits provide new insights into modern Phoenix and how time and place have influenced its development. Excellent shop and bookstore. In the cultural heart of downtown Phoenix at Heritage and Science Park.

properties.name: George Washington Carver Museum
properties.description: Located two blocks south of Chase Field off 7th Street 415 E Grant Street Phoenix, AZ (602) 254-7516 http://www.gwcmuseumculturalcenter.org/ Hours of Operation Tours by appointment Monday – Friday 10AM-3PM Museum Description The Cultural Center features exhibits on Phoenix’s African American history.

properties.name: ASU R. S. Dietz Museum of Geology
ASU Life Sciences Center Living Collection
